In environment V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x v : forall v : V, FE v (f v) (g v) Unable to unify "FV1 ?M1480" with "V".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
V: Type
FV1: V -> Type
FV2: V -> Type
FE: forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v)
f: forall x : V, FV1 x
g: forall x : V, FV2 x

Goal:
RIntro (forall v : V, FE v (f v) (g v)) (forallr - @ v, FE v) f g

Premises:
RIntro : Prop -> rel ?A ?B -> ?A -> ?B -> Prop where ?A : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type] ?B : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type]

rexists_rstep : forall (P : Prop) (R : rel ?A ?B) (m : ?A) (n : ?B), RExists P R m n -> NonDelayed (RAutoSubgoals P) -> RStep True (R m n) where ?A : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type] ?B : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type]
flip_relim : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (m : ?B) (n : ?A) (P Q : Prop), RElim R n m P Q -> RElim (flip R) m n P Q where ?A : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type] ?B : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type]
flip_rexists : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (Rc : rel ?B ?A) (m : ?A) (n : ?B), Convertible R (flip Rc) -> RExists (PolarityResolved Rc -> flip Rc m n) R m n where ?A : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type] ?B : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type]
Convertible : ?A -> ?A -> Prop where ?A : [V : Type FV1 : V -> Type FV2 : V -> Type FE : forall v : V, rel (FV1 v) (FV2 v) f : forall x : V, FV1 x g : forall x : V, FV2 x |- Type]
